jobDescription: Information Technology Internship (18+, unpaid)  Pacific Science Center brings science to life. Our award-winning, interactive programs reach more than 1.3 million people around the state each year in their communities, classrooms and on our campus. We offer a wide variety of exhibits and programs, including standards-based formal and informal science education programs and an award-winning environmental education center.  The Information Technology team at Pacific Science Center seeks to help the organization run a smart and responsible business. The Information Technology Intern will support the efforts of the Technology and Risk Management teams by helping to develop and implement improvements to our PCI (Payment Card Industry) compliance program.  The Information Technology intern will receive support and direction from the Information Technology Manager.  Reports To: Information Technology Manager  Position Start Date: June/July 2018  Position End Date: September 2018  Job Duties Research requirements of PCI compliance and data security standardsWork with IT Manager, Risk Manager and other PSC staff in gathering, formatting and creating documents related to PSC PCI complianceDevelop a plan to continuously keep documentation updated in the futureWork collaboratively with the IT team and other Science Center staff to perform other duties as assigned Learning Opportunities Hands on experience with Microsoft Active Directory administration and the opportunity to apply IT knowledge in a workplace environmentIncrease knowledge of information security and gain a working knowledge of PCI compliance requirementsStrengthen communication skills through diverse interactions with a variety of Science Center staffGain insight into the inner-workings of a successful IT team with a demanding workloadIt may be possible to address additional learning objectives during the course of the internship. Should an interview be extended to a candidate, we welcome a discussion of personal educational goals.
